text: We'll hear argument now in No. 90-1262, Arkansas v. Oklahoma, No. 90-1266, Environmental Protection Agency v. Oklahoma.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
Mr. Wallace, may I interrupt you and ask a question or two?
And so you claim that under the statutory scheme that the Federal Government can have deference on its interpretation of the source State's requirements?
As well as the affected State's.
You don't... do you take the position that the source State's requirements, in this case, Oklahoma, become Federal law, in effect?
The applicable law... Oklahoma is the affected State.
If I may turn very first off to Justice Souter's question regarding section 401(a)(2).
Will you tell us where in the appendix those are?
May I interrupt you with this question?
Justice Souter, what you say would be true if EPA had authority to disapprove any State standard as being too stringent.
Even insofar as it may have an interstate implication?
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
